1.brief: elevation, i.e. the act (literally, a journey to a higher place, figuratively, a thought arising), or (concretely) the condition (literally, a step or grademark, figuratively, a superiority of station); specifically a climactic progression (in certain Psalms)
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
David, the youngest son of Jesse
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to depress literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive (in various applications, as follows)

2.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to promise (pos., to do or give something to God)

3.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
spread, i.e. a bed; (architecture) an extension, i.e. wing or lean-to (a single story or collectively)

4.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
an eyelash (as fluttering); figuratively, morning ray

5.brief: as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a residence (including a shepherd's hut, the lair of animals, figuratively, the grave; also the Temple); specifically, the Tabernacle (properly, its wooden walls)

6.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
a copse of bushes; hence, a forest; hence, honey in the comb (as hived in trees)

7.brief: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a residence (including a shepherd's hut, the lair of animals, figuratively, the grave; also the Temple); specifically, the Tabernacle (properly, its wooden walls)
to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

8.brief: to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
repose or (adverbially) peacefully; figuratively, consolation (specifically, matrimony); hence (concretely) an abode
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)

9.brief: literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)

10.brief: properly, crossed, i.e. (abstractly) transit; used only adverbially, on account of, in order that
David, the youngest son of Jesse
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
anointed; usually a consecrated person (as a king, priest, or saint); specifically, the Messiah

11.brief: to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
David, the youngest son of Jesse
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
to place (in a very wide application)
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)

12.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
properly, to goad, i.e. (by implication) to teach (the rod being an Oriental incentive)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)

13.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
a seat; figuratively, a site; abstractly, a session; by extension an abode (the place or the time); by implication, population

14.brief: repose or (adverbially) peacefully; figuratively, consolation (specifically, matrimony); hence (concretely) an abode
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
this place (French ici), i.e. here or hence
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

15.brief: the chase; also game (thus taken); (generally) lunch (especially for a journey)
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)

16.brief: literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)

17.brief: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to sprout (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative)
a horn (as projecting); by implication, a flask, cornet; by resemblance. an elephant's tooth (i.e. ivory), a corner (of the altar), a peak (of a mountain), a ray (of light); figuratively, power
David, the youngest son of Jesse
to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
a lamp (i.e. the burner) or light (literally or figuratively)
anointed; usually a consecrated person (as a king, priest, or saint); specifically, the Messiah

18.brief: properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
shame (the feeling and the condition, as well as its cause); by implication (specifically) an idol
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to twinkle, i.e. glance; by analogy, to blossom (figuratively, flourish)
properly, something set apart, i.e. (abstractly) dedication (of a priet or Nazirite); hence (concretely) unshorn locks; also (by implication) a chaplet (especially of royalty)
